snippet.textDisplay:
I completely disagree with so many streamers crying about too much bots in game... you have to realize you are the top 1% of skilled fortnite players... of course for you its boring playing against bots, but the majority of players in fortnite are not even close to being that good.

I have had literally 5 friends quite fortnite already, because their lobbies are too sweaty... and ppl saying they should decrease bots... so making it even more sweaty lol....

Tons fo people play fortnite for fun, they jump in once a week or once in 2 weeks to chill a bit in the evening with friends... its not fun doing that when you get crushed every match by sweaty players.

Instead of decreasing bots I think there should be a toggle to play vs bots or without bots... so the pro streamers can choose to play only against players and 96% of the normal players will choose to play against bots.

snippet.textDisplay:
Fortnite is supposed to be a battle royale, but Epic is ruining it by stripping away the game‚Äôs character and personality with random items and by trying too hard to be like Roblox. The extra modes can be fun with friends, but they should never be the main focus. I mainly play ranked battle royale, and now that mode feels ruined. Reload is the only thing I play, but it doesn‚Äôt compare to earlier chapters‚Äîit gets frustrating and repetitive fast. Making OG permanent is also a mistake. Season OG in Chapter 4 worked because it mixed nostalgia with something new, not because it was just recycled.

Fortnite also desperately needs its lore back. I used to log in daily so I wouldn‚Äôt miss an event, a secret skin, or part of the story. Now the game feels empty. On top of that, having four different battle passes at once just makes the game a chaotic mess. And the endless collabs? They‚Äôve lost all meaning. Back then, a collab was a huge deal. Now they‚Äôre constant and feel soulless.

Even worse, Epic has removed most of the good items from battle passes, which comes off as greedy. Compare the old Marvel season battle pass to the recent one: there‚Äôs no real excitement in leveling up anymore. They also need to bring back exclusivity‚Äîwhat‚Äôs the point of grinding a battle pass if those items just end up in the shop later? Exclusivity used to make Fortnite exciting. Since Kicks released, we haven‚Äôt had a single one in the battle pass (besides the OG remix), and the shop versions are overpriced and don‚Äôt even look good on most skins.

The direction Fortnite is heading in feels completely wrong. I‚Äôm posting this under videos because I hope some content creators can share it with the devs. I truly love this game, and I hate seeing it die.

snippet.textDisplay:
I started playing in Chapter 1 Season 8 and was just playing then and through season 9, and X with creative and br and didn‚Äôt really care about the story or anything much then and then chapter 2 came around which was cool but I still wasn‚Äôt super invested in the story yet but I was taking notice to it. By chapter 2 season 2, season 3, and ESPECIALLY season 4 I was completely hooked and obsessed with the storyline and the game in general. I loved every season and genuinely felt a want to play the game. Fracture just felt like a minor miss that Fortnite would come back from but little did I know they really wouldn‚Äôt. And I missed the last really good live event üò≠ (Collision). My play time then started to really slow down throughout chapter 4. The story just wasn‚Äôt the same. I kept hoping that one of the old factions would come back and do something big, and I was lead to believe that multiple times (the oathbound which is old IO, the reality warriors which is the old seven, season 2 with triarch nox which is part of the last reality, and more with the last reality). The story really didn‚Äôt tie together through chapter 4 and that was upsetting. Hey at least the gameplay still felt really amazing. Then we got to when we were about to go back in time. I partly thought this would be cool because I never got to experience chapter 1 season 5-7 but I also felt like it would delete everything in the story so it would feel different and not right. Well we got to chapter 5 and it felt cool but the metaverse was weird. This is where the games story I could clearly tell was basically as good as dead. I just didn‚Äôt get hyped to get on Fortnite anymore barely. Chapter 2 and 3 had me wanting to play everyday. And the way that chapter 4 and 5 ended makes me so mad to this day. Nothing significant. We literally just left the islands. And I think the same thing is gonna happen with Chapter 6 sadly. When chapter 6 came around it felt fun and fresh for a little while and then the same curse of the story and with the metaverse hit. It just doesn‚Äôt feel the same anymore. It‚Äôs still fun to play fortnite don‚Äôt get me wrong but I used to strive to play everyday because of how amazing and enjoyable it was. I just haven‚Äôt had that relationship with Fortnite since the end of chapter 3 - early chapter 4. I don‚Äôt know what Fortnite needs to do to fix this but I think most of the claims in this video are correct. And this all I guess could just be me because I‚Äôm getting older (I‚Äôm 14 almost 15 now) and when I played in chapter 2 and 3 I was younger and found stuff more fun (9-12 years old), but I don‚Äôt know. I think it‚Äôs not just me and it‚Äôs Fortnite.

If you guys stuck around for this whole comment you‚Äôre an absolute legend üíØ. Lmk your opinions.

snippet.textDisplay:
i agree with this video 100%

though i should say you left out a few things catering to a specific group of the fortnite community: The OG lovers. There‚Äôs a group that simply love OG fortnite and the simplicity it had. Not only that but the aesthetics, the art style, and the vibe. Sure they tried with the OG mode but it doesn‚Äôt feel OG.

The OG mode should have a dedicated team of people who actually worked on OG before and or played OG. THERE‚ÄôS TOO MANY INCONSISTENCIES that ruin the immersion and no, i‚Äôm not talking about intentional changes like the rift being red or Revin, i‚Äôm talking about the gun, the player animation, the HUD and UI. (With animations, they should make it a visual setting where if it‚Äôs in your preference, you could turn on so others aren‚Äôt forced to see OG animations. I know the community is split about that.)

When i play fortnite, i find myself hardly playing the new map. I still find fun in OG but it just feels a bit loveless. I find myself thinking that they may not actually care about OG and was just hoping to ride off the hype OG brought in chapter 4. They have to show they care and put in absolute effort.

snippet.textDisplay: It‚Äôs literally just Tim Sweeney. Tim Sweeney is the main issue with Fortnite. Let me explain, when Donald Mustard was the main developer to Fortnite, he had a passion for the game and made it as good as he could, which he most definitely did. When Tim Sweeney came in, Disney came in, and extreme levels of greed followed and caused the only story the game has to be of a collaboration, combine that together and it makes no sense. The first couple seasons with Tim absolutely sucked, I understand getting used to the game when not being the developer but, they didn‚Äôt even care they were so pushy about collabs that they showed no care to their seasonal events or the story line. It‚Äôs why it‚Äôs not enjoyable anymore, the only thing there is competitive players, there‚Äôs no story to have joy from, there‚Äôs only cash grabs. Nothing original, there‚Äôs also terrible moderation with cheats, and I think honestly that the Cronus Zen product should have their producers sued, it‚Äôs legit a platform used for hacks/scripts for consoles. It just seems like the passion and care is gone, there‚Äôs no more love for the game as there once was.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm floored. I've been binge-watching these "Is Fortnite Dying?" videos for the past day. NOT A SINGLE VIDEO resonates with me. All of the videos point to the storyline being the number one culprit. What?! Seriously!? What does the storyline have to do with the gameplay? Ya know, the 99.9999% of Fortnite... Here are the actual issues with Fortnite:

1. Chapter 6 map sucks. It's boring. Compare its biomes and POIs to the diversity of Chapter 5's biomes and POIs. The chapter 6 map looks the same almost everywhere you go. Zzzzz...

2. The loot pool is also boring. For instance, mobility sucks this season. As a player who likes to have fun, I appreciate being able to use my mobility item, such as the Nitro Fists, without worrying about breaking them. Nitro Fists never broke. I was free to use them throughout the game. THAT MADE IT MORE FUN. Chapter 6 mobility items break, leading me to use them way less in an attempt to make it to the end game with some use left. That makes the game more boring. It's not rocket science.

3. Drop hitscan. It's unrealistic and requires less skill. Chapter 5's realistic bullet trajectory made the game more realistic and challenging. When you hit a good long-distance shot, you felt the reward. Hitscan allows players to eliminate another player in almost an instant. Not cool.

4. Create new weapons, utilities, mobility, and heals. Stop unvaulting and create more! The options are endless.

Fortnite is showing signs of complacency. I don't care about the storyline. I care about the GAMING EXPERIENCE. Chapter 6 was a flop for me. It's boring. The map is boring. The loot pool is boring. I'm afraid to use items for fear of breaking them. It's too easy to fry and get fried.

Oh yeah, and the one thing you're right about... Bots. Bots should NOT exist. Period. Revise the SBMM if you have to, Fortnite. But, please, remove all bots.

snippet.textDisplay:
I totally agree!
The changes needed:
We need a lot MORE communication from the Fortnite Devs, like it was in the OG days!
Fortnite need to be wacky, have OP items for limited time and fun again in pubs. And serious only JUST in the competitive modes.
Then everything may will be in place...and...If they may give back the cosmetics rarities.
Without these, Fortnite lost its charm/identity. ü•π
We are missing the flying with the Quadcrasher or using the minigun to boost the Shopping Cart. Now we only have ONE glitch remaining, which the developers left in the game, which became a feature, known as the "Rocket Riding". Even the Bouncer + Driftboard combo super-boostjump for trick-shots were missing, because the updates brought back one or the other and not both at the same time. Legacy Achievements need to come back as well, under our Career tab, so we can show off again with our gaming history in Fortnite. We LOVED these mechanics!
Map grid, player counters in Team Rumble (I remember the 16:16 Team Rumble fight after the mode dropped, but sadly several very bad updates ruined it, like the instant storm, when the match started, the removal of the player counters, instead of implementing "auto team balance", if one team have far (at least 25%) more players then the other, removal of the NPCs, therefore players were not able to do quests in this mode.), other big team modes like 50v50, Food Fight, 25v25v25v25, 5 teams of 20 (it was maybe a "Teams of 12" as well, if I remember right), etc., the "Fortnite - Spy Games" "watch?v=zx3lE3NWNo0" on the official Fortnite channel. There were so many great LTMs (sometimes connected with an event, with rewards, like "14 days of summer"), which we, players are missing. They will be good in a monthly rotation, and this only needs 12 LTMs in a year üòõ. 

- Why they *added* the rarity colors to V-Bucks (1000-13500), after they *removed* it from the locker?
- Why not remove the ingame item rarities too? Are those not "outdated"? One of the CHARM/identity of Fortnite got removed with them! 
Corporate Minimalism have no personality, therefore it have _no place_ in Fortnite. 

TLDR; (just for hard core OG Fortnite players and Epic Games)
My wishes, because I loved to do trap IQ plays (these plays needed to think before you act) ¬ª 
999 material cap, traps like Ceiling Zapper, Wall Dynamo (they were too loud and if someone used they ears and searched for them, then they easily avoided them) and later the Damage Trap, Launch Pad and Bouncer (Super Launch Pading, SypherPK's trap tower and other creative trap builds), Chiller (for rotation or fall damage üòÉ ), Mounted Turret (to spam like with the Minigun), Poison Dart Trap (the only trap in Battle Royale with 3 tile radius....and back then almost everyone tried to use it like the Damage Trap for some reason and made me LOL...and sadly almost all streamer, YouTuber call it "trash", because they used it the WRONG way. You can watch the streamer usage: "Streamers First Time Using the *NEW* "Poison Dart Trap" Item! - Fortnite Best and Funny Moments" or "Streamers FIRST Time Using *NEW* Fortnite POISON DART TRAP Item!! (Broken)" on YouTube...or other videos like these with the search keyword: "Poison Dart Trap" , to do instant damage, with a "bait" trap. 
Usage: Pile some loot from 3 tiles away horizontally (placed the trap on the wall) or vertically (placed it on the ceiling/floor) from this trap, which will be the bait for the enemy, which, if they not box themselves up, then they will get hit by it (1 hit, dealing damage directly to HP: 80 dmg / 7s). 
Or in fights: Place behind you on the wall (horizontal usage) or under/above you on the floor/ceiling, facing towards the enemy and when you open an edit on a wall/ceiling/floor of your build, destroy the enemy wall, which they use to defend themselves, then the trap will be activated if the enemy is max 2 tiles away from your edited wall/ceiling. I totally agree!
The changes needed:
We need a lot MORE communication from the Fortnite Devs, like it was in the OG days!
Fortnite need to be wacky, have OP items for limited time and fun again in pubs. And serious only JUST in the competitive modes.
Then everything may will be in place...and...If they may give back the cosmetics rarities.
Without these, Fortnite lost its charm/identity. ü•π
We are missing the flying with the Quadcrasher or using the minigun to boost the Shopping Cart. Now we only have ONE glitch remaining, which the developers left in the game, which became a feature, known as the "Rocket Riding". Even the Bouncer + Driftboard combo super-boostjump for trick-shots were missing, because the updates brought back one or the other and not both at the same time. Legacy Achievements need to come back as well, under our Career tab, so we can show off again with our gaming history in Fortnite. We LOVED these mechanics!
Map grid, player counters in Team Rumble (I remember the 16:16 Team Rumble fight after the mode dropped, but sadly several very bad updates ruined it, like the instant storm, when the match started, the removal of the player counters, instead of implementing "auto team balance", if one team have far (at least 25%) more players then the other, removal of the NPCs, therefore players were not able to do quests in this mode.), other big team modes like 50v50, Food Fight, 25v25v25v25, 5 teams of 20 (it was maybe a "Teams of 12" as well, if I remember right), etc., the "Fortnite - Spy Games" "watch?v=zx3lE3NWNo0" on the official Fortnite channel. There were so many great LTMs (sometimes connected with an event, with rewards, like "14 days of summer"), which we, players are missing. They will be good in a monthly rotation, and this only needs 12 LTMs in a year üòõ. 

- Why they *added* the rarity colors to V-Bucks (1000-13500), after they *removed* it from the locker?
- Why not remove the ingame item rarities too? Are those not "outdated"? One of the CHARM/identity of Fortnite got removed with them! 
Corporate Minimalism have no personality, therefore it have _no place_ in Fortnite.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hot take, casual mode is and should be non-ranked fortnite, after all, that's how it was in chapter 1, both because there were no bot and SBMM wasn't as annoying as it is now.

We don't need more ways to split the community, we need to real it all back. Casual fortnite should be normal fortnite without aggressive matchmaking so everyone in a 100 player lobby is playing against real players who could be better than them, could be worse than them or exactly at their skill range. Whereas competitive is the place where you go if you want a fully competitive and fair environment that correctly rewards your time and effort.

It shouldn't be that hard to understand.

snippet.textDisplay:
My 3 opinions
1) Fortnite could benefit greatly if it has a solid campaign. As a casual gamer, I have no idea what the storyline is and where we are at in the story bc everything is only revealed in the Royale mode. Have to look up a video on YT to get an explanation. 
2) Creator maps are keeping Fortnite alive, believe it or not. I like hoping on and playing modes like Pillars. To me, it can be more enjoyable than Royale. Epic should continue to provide better resources for creators to improve and/or make better modes/maps.
3) Epic should appreciate the consumer more. It would be nice if once in a blue moon I log on and see a message from Epic saying, "Thank you for continuously playing Fortnite, here is 10,000 VBucks on us." Something like that.

snippet.textDisplay:
The only point I disagree with is 18 with the profile data. That would make the game less inclusive and more toxic just to make room for a little bit of flex. 

Something I think you should have included was fixing storm and storm surge, particularly for competitive. The current meta is super boring to watch. Surge trading and storm tanking make early game too solved and low action. They did change storm in pubs, but I think if they modify the change to only buff early and mid game and keep late game the same for storm that would be better for both modes. 


For storm surge and surge trading specifically, I think they need to change storm surge to damage dealt minus damage taken plus 200 per elimination (granted proportionally per team based on damage dealt after accounting for heals). They also need to let eliminated players' damage dealt still count, otherwise they disincentivize risk and the cringest teams surge trading and hiding in boxes get rewarded more than the teams actually making plays. 


An exciting competitive meta brings people to the game and inspires new pros. But if winning is largely contingent on finding a surge trading partner, then competitive becomes a popularity contest and creates a barrier for new players, especially in high level tournaments. 

Also, the neglected game modes like Team Rumble and LEGO kind of were the casual game modes, or at least one version of that. I get that they are trying to add mobile players back with some of these bot games like Respawn Rumble, but the gamemode is an awful substitute for Team Rumble. If they took the basic rules and just added a non-bot version, even that could be decent. But part of the fun of Team Rumble was the variety of what POIs you would play in. 

I agree there should be a casual BR map as well, but Team Rumble was my favorite by a lot. After Chapter 2 Season 8 I think, they adjusted the storm to close quicker, making it less of a quest, loot, and then play type of game. All that did though was cause more leavers and storm tankers. A casual BR could take the place there, and Team Rumble could be more mid to late game with good starting loot with separate challenges (maybe even with build and zero build versions). 

But most game modes have really subpar challenges and they don't level equally. Tycoon games are the fastest way to level up if you have limited time but want to finish the passes. They rely on forcing grind for those players rather than the other exciting elements they used to have and more intrinsically rewarding gameplay. Having the option to pick a real players only lobby, even if slightly smaller and with a longer wait time, would be way more fun than some of these bot heavy game modes. This would also give casual quest players a place to go that doesn't interfere with people who actually just want to play the game.

Whoever is leading the problem solving of a lot of the game modes just isn't doing a great job. They seem to split over what types of feedback to even listen to and don't have a clear vision of what they are trying to accomplish with each game mode.

snippet.textDisplay: The last time I played Fortnite was when Juice WRLD was in the item shop since then I haven‚Äôt touched the game and everything you said is 100% accurate and should be done to bring me back to Fortnite. And one thing I think they should go back to is where they had three different game modes when you loaded up the game.  Where all the way on the left was saved the world in the middle was battle Royale, and on the right was creative. And if you wanted to play a creative experience, you would click on creative and then you would see the whole menu for creative and everything that is with creative. Then when you click on battle Royale, you would see all the modes that are just for about battle, Royale, and it felt so much more organized in my personal opinion. Since the whole menu change, it‚Äôs just been really badly organized. Also, I know Fortnite will never do this, but I think they should go back to skins having rarity. I remember playing back in chapter 1 when a brand new legendary skin came out and you bought it. You could feel the hype and flex. Oh, I just bought a legendary skin. Or oh I just bought this epic skin and it felt like more of a satisfying purchase. Now when you buy something in Fortnite, it‚Äôs just like oh I bought this new skin doesn‚Äôt feel that like rewarding.

snippet.textDisplay:
I've stopped playing fortnite daily about 2-3 weeks ago (after playing minimum a couple hours every week since 2018) because playing the game felt like such a chore. One of my main issues with the game is that the battle pass system/season lengths is/are flawed. If you want to get all 200 rewards before the season ends, you HAVE to get 3.5 levels EVERYDAY. Originally, it didn't bother me too much, as back when it started (Chapter 5-ish I think, I have no idea) I loved the game. Chapter 5 was so much fun for me. But now, I feel so disconnected from Chapter 6, and I couldn't tell you why. But playing the game everyday, getting the 3-4 levels is such a hassle. I don't even have an hour or gameplay in the new season because, as much as it sucks for me, I don't think I can get myself to do it. Just give more time to unlock rewards in battle passes. 

Marvel Rivals has a pretty good battle pass system. Not nearly as many rewards, and you get about 3 months to get everything. I feel like there's plenty opportunities to get the BP currency to unlock everything, and as an added bonus, once you complete the BP, you can get in-game currency with any leftover BP credits. And there's also enough events going on every season to make up for (if you think there is) a lack in quantity of items in the BP.

snippet.textDisplay:
My biggest issue now is the map. the map looks horrible. It has hardly any fun poi's/landmarks left, All the bug places from this season look the same, the two big superhero poi's looked the same, all gasstations look the same and it's just a bunch of copy/paste work instead of fun and unique places. I almost feel bad for talking sh*t about the jungle in Ch4 cause even that jungle was a lot better than what we have now. 

Also the storyline quests are just generic quests like "get me this, talk to him/her" and after 5 of 6 of those it tells you "next storyline quests are available in 28 days" like.. what?..


And some people want harder games to play, other people want more casual games to play. So have a normal option (real people and bots mixed) then a hard one where it's 90% real players or something, and a Bot lobby for people who just want to chill and do their quests or something.

They need to focus more on their BR mode cause that's still the main reason why people play fortnite and they need to either stop focusing on creative so much or step their game up so that creative ACTUALLY gets good. because 90% of the creative maps are absolute dog poop at this point

I think the essence of Fortnite is kinda missing, if that makes sense. I picked up the game in chapter 1 season 3 and dropped it midway through chapter 2, and when I came back (this would've been right when they introduced no-build), the game was SO far removed from a BR with all the quests and boss battles and bounties and NPCs, not to mention how disengaging the bots made the game feel (though I will say I like the bots, younger audiences who are still learning the game can feel some fulfillment killing the bots instead of being blown off the map by some crackheaded sweat, and it does mitigate the whole SBMM crisis that happened in chapter 1). 
Admittedly though, and maybe this is just because I'm old and hate change, but playing OG, it's so much nicer. The kits are simpler, less weapons, less random throwable crap, no NPCs, it's just pick up weapons and shoot things, and I think that would be a massive plus if they rolled back to what it was like in chapter 1 (in my opinion anyway). 
Not to mention, UEFN is dogshit. The number of random workarounds I have to do to fix rudimentary problems because UEFN just isn't getting the support it deserves is really sad. While it's clear Fortnite wants to become a community game platform that happens to have a BR mode, they can't do that if the community game platform bit works like absolute horseshit.

snippet.textDisplay:
I‚Äôm so glad someone is mentioning the storyline issue. It‚Äôs probably one of the main things that got me into playing Fortnite. It was fun and had an interesting storyline. I don‚Äôt want to be that guy, but when Donald Mustard was gone you could feel the story changing. The whole Geno, The Seven, IO, The Last Reality, Cube Queen, and everything else in the midst of all that went away. Then the story underwent a soft reset of sorts and sure we‚Äôll get teases here and there of old stuff, but it never goes anywhere. Then we get Midas back after all the teases and hype. All of that hype was completely wasted for the sake of Dr. Doom trying to blow up the map.

Don‚Äôt even get me started on the Fracture live event. It had so much hype around it, and what did we get? Two minutes at most of us fighting TLR and then the rest of the event was, ‚ÄúCheck out our new creative map system!‚Äù Then we got the rocket live event. Super exciting, omg what‚Äôs going to happen? ‚ÄúHere are three new games for you to play that we‚Äôre going to abandon!!!!‚Äù

It has become clear to me that all Fortnite, more specifically Tim Sweeney, cares about is the ‚Äúmetaverse.‚Äù It‚Äôs so sad to see what was once an engaging game both narratively and gameplay-wise lose its shine.

snippet.textDisplay: CouRage, I genuinely want to say thank you to yourself, Ninja, Tim, and some others, for being some of the only Fortnite content creators that have tried other games and catered to their audience instead of shoving the same old content down their audiences throats until they unsubscribeüòÇ thank you for being willing to try other games even though that might mean you may lose some of your audience you gained from Fortnite. In doing so you have reached others who, not only like you because they are addicted to Fortnite and its content, but enjoy watching YOUR content because of YOU. I know it might sound stupid to say thank you for something as small as this to me,(and yes I know that all the little Timmies will come into the chat bashing me because Fortnite is the only thing they have) because I know it meant the world to you. You literally had to take the chance at leaving one of the games that helped you become more wide spread on social media platforms and by doing so, risked the well being of your job, your family, and in the long run, even some parts of your life for better or worse. I know that I only found your content about 2 years ago here on YouTube, and have not been watching your content for even half the amount of time as many of your supporters, but as a fellow young adult who understands reality, I just want to tell you you‚Äôre doing a pretty damn well jobüòÇ better than my content journey (non existent at the moment but a dream of mine, and am gonna get there someday.) I know I say this for many of your hardcore viewers who have stuck with you through the years, We DO Appreciate you for, as sone would say, ‚Äúgrowing up with your audience.‚Äù You don‚Äôt stay a kid forever, but the memories and people you had live on in youü´µ forever as long as you live, and that‚Äôs what really matters. Just want to encourage you and your family cause you never know when someone might be going through a ruff time in life, and it‚Äôs a whole lot better to say something nice than to tear someone down. Thank you CouRage & Family! -YaBoyNalu‚úåÔ∏è

snippet.textDisplay:
As a UEFN Creator, i agree. UEFN is so lacking in functionality. You'd be suprised the shortcuts, or bypass methods we have to use to make things happen. a good example of this is something simple like float values. Verse does not support rounding to decimal places with the float. So anytime i use it i get numbers like 4.123456 and i have to create a long function to just change it to 4.12 UEFN is actually so limited and it makes me so mad.

Regarding the Menu UI. Im told that the current engine just cant support many improvements to the UI.

snippet.textDisplay: What killed Fortnite for me was the removal of Team Rumble. It was my go to favorite mode to grind every day and it allowed me to experience the new Battle Royale content each season without actually having to play Battle Royale but now that Team Rumble is gone I just don't care about Fortnite anymore like I still play it to complete the battlepass but I spend all my time doing Escape Rooms or Tycoons or doing Steal A Brainrot or Horror Maps and stuff like that. The new training grounds mode is just awful, yes it has unlimited respawns like Team Rumble but your literally playing at the exact same location every match against the exact same ai and its just too bland and generic to be fun.
